body: @jiangtaoli2016 can you have a look, please?

@jiangtaoli2016 Thanks for triggering test, is there any way to check how builds are failing? Details link leads to google internal network which I don't have access to. (or in other words - how can I run "sanity test" locally?)

I am not sure whether you can see the internal test logs.
Have you ran the following to test locally?

`./tools/run_tests/run_tests.py -l c`

Ah, okay.. Pinned versions in git (used by run_tests.py) and bazel workspace are different and boringssl changed api in-between.. Do we support both boringssl versions or are there specific reasons why they are not in sync?

I will try to fix it regardless but curious about state of the world.
Ok, fixed this one, next one is inability to use std::unordered_map (I hoped it's header only), will update cl by moving to avl tree & self-written linked list

You can use the following command to get the latest boringSSL module in gRPC.
`git submodule update`

I already have up-to-date bazel in git ([4d7ba4e4e57195fcebdabe01489534b446ad02cb](https://github.com/google/boringssl/blob/4d7ba4e4e57195fcebdabe01489534b446ad02cb/include/openssl/ssl.h#L1644)), though bazel workspace points to [886e7d75368e3f4fab3f4d0d3584e4abfc557755](https://github.com/google/boringssl/blob/886e7d75368e3f4fab3f4d0d3584e4abfc557755/src/include/openssl/ssl.h#L1560) and this two commits have different signature for `SSL_SESSION_new` function.

It looks like gRPC uses system's openssl library. Could you try 
sudo apt-get remove libssl-dev

It is unfortunate that all the grpc tests currently assume using boringSSL. We will have better tests OpenSSL library this year.

Just to be clear - I was able to reproduce this error with boringssl using `./tools/run_tests/run_tests.py -l c`, my point is that it compiles perfectly using `bazel test //test/core/tsi:ssl_session_cache_test`. It happens due to the fact that `bazel test` & `make` build binary against different versions of boringssl..
Building grpc against system OpenSSL opens one another interesting world of incompatibilities which I'm trying to solve as well.
@jiangtaoli2016 hi, code should build with different variations of boringssl and openssl now as well as doesn't depend on libstdc++, can you re-trigger tests please?

(fixed code style, documentation indicates that it can cause sanity check failures)
@jiangtaoli2016 I believe I've fixed some more style & generated files issues, can you kick tests again please?

@euroelessar BTW, you can run most of the tests locally using docker, e.g., 
`./tools/run_tests/run_tests.py --use_docker -l c -c asan`
Yep, I was able to repro & fix asan c test this way, though it takes forever to actually run a full suite and I don't have access to build logs to run only necessary tests.
You can use `-r regex` to test the related tests.
But I don't know which specific tests did fail as I don't have access to CI results.
